nodes.text: Bumping compensation should apply to all carriers
dlpoole(558): Bumping compensation should apply to all carriers
Annot: Bumping compensation should apply to all carriers
because of the increasing use of regional carriers to serve smaller markets
dlpoole(558): because of the increasing use of regional carriers to serve smaller markets
Annot: because of the increasing use of regional carriers to serve smaller markets
and their no lesser disruptiveness and potential expense to the traveler.
dlpoole(558): and their no lesser disruptiveness and potential expense to the traveler.
Annot: and their no lesser disruptiveness and potential expense to the traveler.
Passengers may lack check cashing privileges away from their home airport, yet face unplanned and likely elevated expenses after being "bumped."
dlpoole(558): Passengers may lack check cashing privileges away from their home airport, yet face unplanned and likely elevated expenses after being "bumped."
Annot: Passengers may lack check cashing privileges away from their home airport, yet face unplanned and likely elevated expenses after being "bumped."
They should have a mandatory option of cash payment.
dlpoole(558): They should have a mandatory option of cash payment.
Annot: They should have a mandatory option of cash payment.
An credit card credit, if immediate, would be more secure and as useful to more passengers than either a check or cash.
dlpoole(558): An credit card credit, if immediate, would be more secure and as useful to more passengers than either a check or cash.
Annot: An credit card credit, if immediate, would be more secure and as useful to more passengers than either a check or cash.
The proposed compensation limits are too low to provide an incentive to the airlines to limit overbooking
dlpoole(558): The proposed compensation limits are too low to provide an incentive to the airlines to limit overbooking
Annot: The proposed compensation limits are too low to provide an incentive to the airlines to limit overbooking
and may be arbitrarily unfair to certain travelers.
dlpoole(558): and may be arbitrarily unfair to certain travelers.
Annot: and may be arbitrarily unfair to certain travelers.
The Wall Street Journal recently reproposed a 1977 proposal by the late economist Julian Simon of an auction that would offer bumped passengers a gradually rising reward for giving up their seat.

dlpoole(558): The Wall Street Journal recently reproposed a 1977 proposal by the late economist Julian Simon of an auction that would offer bumped passengers a gradually rising reward for giving up their seat.

Annot: The Wall Street Journal recently reproposed a 1977 proposal by the late economist Julian Simon of an auction that would offer bumped passengers a gradually rising reward for giving up their seat.
The arguments are rather compelling.
dlpoole(558): The arguments are rather compelling.
Annot: The arguments are rather compelling.
See the WSJ, June 8, 2010, "Auctions for Overbooking"  or
dlpoole(558): See the WSJ, June 8, 2010, "Auctions for Overbooking"  or
Annot: See the WSJ, June 8, 2010, "Auctions for Overbooking"  or
Annot: http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052748703303904575293011757655060.html
The airlines will overbook so as to optimize their financial results under any given set of caps,
dlpoole(558): The airlines will overbook so as to optimize their financial results under any given set of caps,
Annot: The airlines will overbook so as to optimize their financial results under any given set of caps,
so some passengers will still be involuntarily denied boarding on overbooked flights.
dlpoole(558): so some passengers will still be involuntarily denied boarding on overbooked flights.
Annot: so some passengers will still be involuntarily denied boarding on overbooked flights.
An auction will more accurately price the delay
dlpoole(558): An auction will more accurately price the delay
Annot: An auction will more accurately price the delay
and the sellers (the delayed passenger(s)) will be left with no complaint that it was involuntary.
dlpoole(558): and the sellers (the delayed passenger(s)) will be left with no complaint that it was involuntary.
Annot: and the sellers (the delayed passenger(s)) will be left with no complaint that it was involuntary.
An auction would also force the carriers to face the cost of overbooking in customer dissatisfaction and better inform their flight scheduling decisions.
dlpoole(558): An auction would also force the carriers to face the cost of overbooking in customer dissatisfaction and better inform their flight scheduling decisions.
Annot: An auction would also force the carriers to face the cost of overbooking in customer dissatisfaction and better inform their flight scheduling decisions.
I recall hearing seats being auctioned by progressive increases in the promised compensation by gate agents,
dlpoole(558): I recall hearing seats being auctioned by progressive increases in the promised compensation by gate agents,
Annot: I recall hearing seats being auctioned by progressive increases in the promised compensation by gate agents,
but that was long, long ago and under far greater seat availability and lower probabilities of cascading delays and subsequent denials of boarding for those who took the compensation.
dlpoole(558): but that was long, long ago and under far greater seat availability and lower probabilities of cascading delays and subsequent denials of boarding for those who took the compensation.
Annot: but that was long, long ago and under far greater seat availability and lower probabilities of cascading delays and subsequent denials of boarding for those who took the compensation.
Those procedures were surely regulated by DOT,
dlpoole(558): Those procedures were surely regulated by DOT,
Annot: Those procedures were surely regulated by DOT,
(perhaps when the industry was more heavily regulated,)
dlpoole(558): (perhaps when the industry was more heavily regulated,)
Annot: (perhaps when the industry was more heavily regulated,)
so perhaps those earlier rules should be revisited.
dlpoole(558): so perhaps those earlier rules should be revisited.
Annot: so perhaps those earlier rules should be revisited.

Let's keep in mind that a bumped passenger may miss a cruise ship departure, miss a connecting flight, lose a day (or sometimes more) of a prepaid vacation, or miss a wedding or funeral because the airline was greedy and didn't want even one empty seat on their flight.

drmikeb100(1012): Let's keep in mind that a bumped passenger may miss a cruise ship departure, miss a connecting flight, lose a day (or sometimes more) of a prepaid vacation, or miss a wedding or funeral because the airline was greedy and didn't want even one empty seat on their flight.

Annot: Let's keep in mind that a bumped passenger may miss a cruise ship departure, miss a connecting flight, lose a day (or sometimes more) of a prepaid vacation, or miss a wedding or funeral because the airline was greedy and didn't want even one empty seat on their flight.

If being bumped from a flight caused additional problems for the bumped passenger(s) then the passenger(s) should be able to submit proof of loss and the airline should have to compensate WITHOUT LIMIT in addition to the proposed penalties.

drmikeb100(1012): If being bumped from a flight caused additional problems for the bumped passenger(s) then the passenger(s) should be able to submit proof of loss and the airline should have to compensate WITHOUT LIMIT in addition to the proposed penalties.

Annot: If being bumped from a flight caused additional problems for the bumped passenger(s) then the passenger(s) should be able to submit proof of loss and the airline should have to compensate WITHOUT LIMIT in addition to the proposed penalties.
I also like the idea of pre notification of bumping.
drmikeb100(1012): I also like the idea of pre notification of bumping.
Annot: I also like the idea of pre notification of bumping.
It can cost well over $100 to get to an airport (for example, central NJ to JFK is about $150 and for a long vacation this is cheaper than airport parking).
drmikeb100(1012): It can cost well over $100 to get to an airport (for example, central NJ to JFK is about $150 and for a long vacation this is cheaper than airport parking).
Annot: It can cost well over $100 to get to an airport (for example, central NJ to JFK is about $150 and for a long vacation this is cheaper than airport parking).
When a passenger is bumped and the next available flight is the next day this can mean an additional $300+ in travel costs.
drmikeb100(1012): When a passenger is bumped and the next available flight is the next day this can mean an additional $300+ in travel costs.
Annot: When a passenger is bumped and the next available flight is the next day this can mean an additional $300+ in travel costs.
